page.title: 17FARMING IN CULWORTH AREA
page.content: {TRAFFORD HOUSE FARM} A beautiful family run farm on the edge of our block.Of particular interest due to the site of the Medieval Village on the land.Mostly sheep kept but also a few Polo ponies for the family use. {BLACKBIRD HILL FARM} A typical example of a small family farm,surviving in competition with large commercial concerns.Mr and Mrs Leadbeater,the farmer and his wife and their two children all work on the farm and enjoy their life.Their land is all permanent pasture,they keep sheep.A typical day starts at 6:30am and ends at dark,except at lambing time when they sometimes have to stay up all night looking after the ewes and their lambs.MrLeadbeater sometimes comes in for his dinner and sometimes has it outside when Mrs Leadbeater makes him sandwiches or brings it to him.
